stream_context.summary: Kaze prototyped a mine-cart chase set-piece for the new cowboy cave level, importing graphics and refining camera, physics and cut-scene logic.

development_findings.summary: He spent the past week importing Biobak’s new environment models and believes the level now “looks pretty good”.
development_findings.quote: I kind of spent the last two weeks working on this level here importing Biobak’s things

development_findings.summary: Red-coin stars no longer eject the player; 100-coin stars are being removed and replaced by a global coin counter.
development_findings.quote: I also made it so that red coin stars don't put you out of the stage anymore… There’s no 100 coin stars in this game. There will be a global coin counter.

development_findings.summary: Initial plan: three Snifits jump into separate mine-carts that the player must hop between while dodging bullets; difficulty balancing led to a pivot toward one large cart for Mario plus three small enemy carts.
development_findings.quote: Swapping between minecarts is really, really difficult… What if instead of three small ones, there's just one big one that you can walk around on?

development_findings.summary: Cut-scene added to lock Mario while Snifits board the carts, preventing unfair early jumps and squish deaths.
development_findings.quote: The only solution here is a cutscene. I'm pretty sure.

development_findings.summary: Camera clipping bug traced to misused ‘keep in’ / ‘keep out’ flags (index 3 allowed wall penetration); fixed by using correct single flag.
development_findings.quote: I feel like there is a bug with the camera code… when we have both on, they actually turn into three and three means it can always go through.

development_findings.summary: Mine-cart motion uses spline paths; Kaze tunes speed with BParam values—faster on outer rails early, slower later—to keep carts aligned.
development_findings.quote: These variables make the minecart go faster or slower at the beginning, so they stay more in line with each other.

development_findings.summary: New sound set: ground-pound jump from Mario Kart 64, spin-jump voice from Smash Melee, longer falling scream; still open to tweaking pitch/length.
development_findings.quote: I just realized… here are the new sounds. I do like the new sounds but I think they are a little bit improvable.

development_findings.summary: He experimented with vertex lighting (using polygons instead of textures) for the moonlight but couldn’t achieve desired look.
development_findings.quote: It’d be cheaper to use polys instead of a texture for lighting. Yes… I tried it but I couldn't make it look good.

development_findings.summary: Engine supports setting camera angle on level entry; used to frame mine-cart start.
development_findings.quote: There's actually a cool feature in my engine… allows you to set the camera angle on level entry.

context_findings.summary: Kaze distrusts modern healthcare; prefers self-directed physiotherapy after doctors suggested cortisone and painkillers.
context_findings.quote: I kind of just gave up on doctors. Every time I went… it's just been worse for me.

context_findings.summary: Personal finance hiccup: PayPal has frozen his funds so he can spend but not transfer; weighing purchases or public complaints.
context_findings.quote: They refused to let me use my PayPal money… Anyone got an idea what I should do with that?

context_findings.summary: Considers hiring a part-time social media manager to boost Twitter impressions for monetization.
context_findings.quote: I'm thinking we need to go all out on Twitter… I should hire a social media manager.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on cleanliness: sees housecleaning as wasted time; previously hired a cleaning lady in Germany.
context_findings.quote: Maybe that's why I shouldn't clean because I genuinely don't care. I think it is a waste of time.

context_findings.summary: Displays enthusiasm for analog stick ‘invention’ and laments modern games lacking true analog input.
context_findings.quote: They invented this in 1996 and there are still games… that don't use this.

context_findings.summary: Recurring frustration with loud household furnace during stream, revealing work-from-home challenges.
context_findings.quote: Oh, it's turned on again. We live in agony today.

biobak.summary: Provided the new cowboy cave environment assets that Kaze imported this week.
biobak.quote: This whole thing is a homage to your work… importing Biobak’s things

zeina.summary: Kaze asked Zeina to model milk bottles for the level and plans to use her spin-jump animation.
zeina.quote: Zeina, you make milk bottles. I need them… I'm also going to give him the Melee spin jump animation here

zeina.summary: Her upstairs activity (heater/furnace noise) repeatedly interrupted the stream, highlighting home-studio overlap.
zeina.quote: Oh my god, Zeina, shut up. This is so annoying. Why is she doing this to me?

key_stories.title: Designing the Mine-cart Chase
key_stories.summary: Kaze tries to create a dynamic mine-cart section where Snifits chase Mario. Early tests with three separate carts proved too punishing, leading to speed tuning, cut-scenes, and finally a pivot to placing Mario in one larger cart for maneuverability.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing difficulty and fairness when players jump between moving carts while being shot at.
key_stories.process: Adjusted spline speeds, added cut-scene lock, experimented with camera flags, and considered cart geometry changes.
key_stories.outcome: Prototype now works: cut-scene triggers, carts align, player rides a larger cart; shooting logic and visuals still pending.
key_stories.key_quote: Swapping between minecarts is really, really difficult… What if there's just one big one that you can walk around on?

key_stories.title: The PayPal Freeze
key_stories.summary: Kaze’s PayPal account lets him spend funds only on certain sites but blocks transfers. He brainstorms purchases like CS:GO skins and contemplates calling PayPal out on Twitter.
key_stories.challenge: Accessing trapped project and personal funds.
key_stories.process: Asked chat for ideas; weighed public complaint versus alternative spending.
key_stories.key_quote: They refused to let me use my PayPal money… Anyone got an idea what I should do with that?

key_stories.title: Doctors vs. Self-Treatment
key_stories.summary: After elbow and wrist injuries, doctors prescribed cortisone and painkillers. Kaze ignored them, did physiotherapy, and recovered, reinforcing his skepticism of medical advice.
key_stories.challenge: Chronic joint pain impacting his work.
key_stories.process: Visited doctors, rejected their guidance, researched and performed physio.
key_stories.outcome: Pain improved; lingering distrust of healthcare system.
key_stories.key_quote: It's much better to actually do proper physiotherapy and fix the underlying problem instead of just injecting medicine.
